name: Hostal Avalon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent an idyllic week at the Avalon in June.The room was lovely with a balcony that was the perfect place to share a pre-dinner glass of wine while gazing at the spectacular vista.We sampled breakfast, lunch and dinner and it was the best food we have ever had in any hotel anywhere!The Tapas Fusion evening with Flamenco dancing and music was a perfect way to end our vacation.Alix and Kevin greeted us like old friends, they could not have made our stay any more enjoyable. We can't wait to go back to Nerja and the Avalon
reviews.title: A perfect escape

A dreamy view and superb restaurant
reviews.text: Alix and Kevin have created a little slice of heaven by the sea. A stroll along the beach from Nerja, their hostel is situated on the side of a hill overlooking the beach, the sea, the mountains and the town. The view is spectacular, of the kind you dream about when you think of Spain. A short walk through Alix's beautiful garden and you are on the beach, ready for a dip in the mediterranean. Not only its location and outlook but the rooms are beautiful with amazing balconies overlooking it all, the price is so friendly and the hosts are charming. Kevin's restaurant is pretty phenomenal. We had our best meal of Spain there, the food is stupidly good and the view to die for. So if you're thinking of Nerja, go for Hostal Avalon, it's so close to the town if you need to go in and get your fix of the hullaballoo but then you can wander back home along the beach to dine in paradise.

My daughter and I with a close friend had superb meals at this delightful restaurant. We ate here on more than one occassion so I can comment very, very positively on the Fillet Steak, Spare Ribs, Dorada and Chicken Curry dishes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose to stay at Hostal Avalon based on other tripadvisor comments. The hotel is a little far out of town, which is what we were hoping for. The food was very good, the staff was excellent and I would recommend this for a place to stay if you are interested in Nerja. The beds were a dream!
reviews.title: Dinner at El Avalon
SHOULD BE CALLED "HOSTAL HAVEN"!
reviews.text: We live in Torrox Costa, decided to try El Avalon for an evening meal to celebrate buying a new car, and were very impressed. Service is fabulous, attentive, prompt and no mistakes! We were both delighted with our starters, main course and desert. We will be back, with friends and family.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views are amazing from this property. So is the price and staff. We had a good stay here but if you don’t have a car I would not stay here. It is a ways out of town. Even with a car it was sometimes hard to find parking in the city center. We opted to not get breakfast as I felt it was to expensive for what you got. We did get coffee every am which was fantastic. Also the Sangria was a bit over priced. It was $15 Euros for a picture. I got great tasting Sangria in town for $5. Overall great stay for the price and would not haste to go again. I just know I wont be eating at the hotel.
reviews.title: Great views

reviews.text: I have recently returned from a long weekend in Nerja Spain and stayed in The Avalon. It was really lovely, with lovely owners Alix and Kevin. They were friendly, easy to get on with, whilst being very professional. The room was comfortable, clean and a good size, and the view was amazing looking out over the beach and sea.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel and views

reviews.text: Myself and a friend spent seven nights here recently and had a fabulous time. The Hostal Avalon provides basic, comfortable accomodation in a beautiful setting, but the jewel in the crown of the Avalon is the food!
reviews.title: Great food, fabulous setting

reviews.text: The hostal is run by an English couple, Kevin & Alix. Alix made us feel really welcome from the moment we arrived, while Kevin is an excellent chef. The food is superb, with equal attention paid to breakfast and lunch, as well as dinner. You would not get food of this quality for the price anywhere in Dublin, that's for sure! Each afternoon we saw Alix in the gardens picking herbs and vegetables for the kitchen and all the sauces and garnishes, not to mention the chunky chips, were to die for.
reviews.title: Great views, good food at reasonable prices

reviews.text: As others have mentioned the beds were really comfy and we slept like babies each night.
reviews.title: The Restaurant food is outstanding!

reviews.text: Just be aware that there is no hairdryer, ironing board or kettle provided, so be prepared for that. This is not a criticism, just a point of information if you're thinking of going.
reviews.title: Exceptional

reviews.text: If we return to Nerja, we would not consider staying anywhere else, and that's the best recommendation I can give!
reviews.title: Terrific Food, Fantastic People

description: Traditional Andalucian Hostal with beautiful views of Nerja, Playazo beach and the Almijara mountains. 50 metres from the beach. All rooms en-suite with large terraces overlooking the sea, air con, free wifi and satelite TV . Restaurant, bar and terrace open all day, everyday. Large, free car park.
